DataElement.preferredName: Chronic Graft Versus Host Disease Transplant Discontinue Treatment Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no response to a question related to the discontinuation of treatment for chronic graft versus host disease.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Chronic Graft Versus Host Disease Transplant Discontinue Treatment
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the treatment of chronic graft versus host disease following transplant._To stop or end, permanently or temporarily.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A disease or condition that persists or progresses over a long period of time.:Graft-versus-host disease. A reaction of donated bone marrow or peripheral stem cells against a person's tissue.

Concepts.definition: Usually used to describe a condition that is persistent and long standing.
Graft-versus-host disease. A reaction of donated bone marrow or peripheral stem cells against a person's tissue.

Property.preferredDefinition: Tissue or organ transplanted from a donor to a recipient.:To stop or end, permanently or temporarily.:An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

Concepts.definition: Tissue or organ transplanted from a donor to a recipient.
To stop or end, permanently or temporarily.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).
